content:
And the last from me (at this time).

The focus of the session might be best on the design of the tracks - though happy to go with whatever people want.

I've been trying to do the R4 upgrade for both Logical Modeller and conman (as the 2 go together quite nicely) but it's very much as work in progress and needs testing (hint :) ) Seems to be working...

This could even be done on the the friday session. An iterative process of:
1. create a track
2. add the scenarios
3. quickly create graphs for each scenario (references and text only)
4. review - does this work?
5. modify as required,

With the output being polished tracks. After all, the building of graphs against those tracks can be done any time and anywhere - and (unlike the scenario builder) anyone can view any of the graphs...
